newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek Intrakom signs 1.0mln mark NATO missile deal.
newsitem.headline: Greek Intrakom signs 1.0mln mark NATO missile deal.

text.p: Greek telecommunications and defence manufacturer Intracom said it signed a contract worth one million marks with German firm BGT to design and develop parts for air-to-air IRIS-T missiles for NATO.
The accord was signed today by Intracom's managing director, Costas Tsoukalidis, and Reiner Ott, managing director of German BGT, the main contractor of the IRIS-T programme.
The signing took place in Piraeus at the international Defendory military exhibition.
Intracom will design and develop electronic parts and software for the new air-to-air missile, its statement said.
"In the first phase of the programme, Intracom has assumed the integration of IRIS-T on F-16 fighter planes," it said.
Greece participates in the IRIS-T programme budgeted at 3.0 billion marks with a stake of 6.0 percent, it said. --Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
